result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Charles Kirsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- Restitution is set at $0.

- No contact with firearms.
- 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".

- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention continued programming.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

- AODA and recommended treatment/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: - Serve 60 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 10-07-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 21.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Charles Kirsch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gary Charles Kirsch in court.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Gary Charles Kirsch in court with attorney Warren J. Klaus.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 days time served.  The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 10-07-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 21.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention continued programming.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- AODA and recommended treatment/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- Restitution is set at $0.
- 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gary Charles Kirsch in court with attorney Warren J. Klaus.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for plea and sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form, signed and filed.   All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to Br 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Defendant missed office visit.   No action taken by the court at this time.

Attorney Warren J. Klaus in court.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not appearing.  Statements by defense counsel that defendant has been hospitalized.  Defense requests another status date 4 weeks out.  State has no objection.  Court orders case adjourned to Br 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed:  missed office visit on 4-21-2016.  Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date of 6-02-2016.

Attorney Warren J. Klaus in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not appearing.  Statements by defense counsel that defendant is in the hospital.  Parties joint request to vacate 5-11-2016 jury trial date, granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for status conference to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Victim in court requesting the court to lift the No Contact Order.  Court modifies the No Contact Order to NO VIOLENT contact.  Defendant to have no violent contact with Linda K.

Defendant Gary Charles Kirsch in court with attorney Warren J. Klaus.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. 

  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Gary Charles Kirsch in court with attorney Warren J. Klaus.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court in trial, case heard off the record. Defendant involved in treatment.  Defense counsel requests case be set for another pretrial conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with L.M.K. DOB 11/17/59.

Defendant Gary Charles Kirsch in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Gary Charles Kirsch in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT AND DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:15 am.
